reason.raw: Fixing issues. Will re-open when ready.

description.raw:
Redo of pull request #2107, which was broken into:

* pull request #2220 (merged)
* pull request #2263 (merged)
* pull request #2309 (merged)
* this PR

This pull request makes it possible to open a world  without restarting the server. The client is not working yet, so a way to test this would be:

1. Build the example publishers added in this PR

2. Start gzserver with a world of your choosing

3. Publish either a new world or open world message using the standalone publishers:
    * ./pub_new_world
    * ./pub_open_world <full path>

4. Now open gzclient and check that the new world has been opened and there are no traces of the old world.

[trusty gpu](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/main/view/CI%20any%20jobs/job/gazebo-ci-pr_any-trusty-amd64-gpu-nvidia/414/) ok

[ABI](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-abichecker-any_to_any-xenial-amd64/1/API_ABI_report/) not broken
